description.hltext_display: Cotto's Adviser: Mayorga Would Make Interesting Hype
description.author: Lem Satterfield
description.content:
By Lem Satterfield
Gabriel Penagaricano, the legal adviser for WBA junior middleweight titlist Miguel Cotto, believes Ricardo Mayorga would make for an interesting opponent. Cotto is scheduled to return on March 12 at the MGM Grand in Las Vegas. Mayorga (29-7-1, 22 KOs) is among those being considered by Top Rank Promotions CEO, Bob Arum, to face Cotto (35-2, 28 KOs), along with New Jersey's Pawel Wolak (28-1, 18 KOs) and, unbeaten Armenian-born prospect Vanes Martirosyan (28-0, 17), of Glendale, Calif.
Mayorga, a former champion at 147 and 154, is well known for his wild pre-fight antics. Penagaricano feels Mayorga is a good fighter who will create a very interesting promotion with his wild nature."It's still a bit early because we are just starting to talk about the different economic options for each fight," said Penagaricano to David Castro of Fanaticos [FanHouse Espanol]. "I hope we do have a resolution soon. Of course, there are bigger fights out there, but we are discussing different options [with Bob Arum,]. He's brought this fight to our attention because it would make for an interesting promotion.""Ricardo Mayorga is still a very good fighter. He has been inactive, but he had a great fight with Fernando Vargas not that long ago." Lem Satterfield is the boxing editor at AOL FanHouse and the news editor at BoxingScene.com. To read more from Lem Satterfield, go to AOL FanHouse by Clicking Here.
LOL the Vargas-Mayorga fight was 3 years ago. I doubt Mayorga can make 154, why is Top Rank wasting Cotto's time with this mismatch. I hope HBO does counter program this PPV so it bombs. mayorga vs cotto would be interesting:lol1: I can only imagine the press conferences

description.hltext_display: Nuevo embajador en Colombia presenta hoy sus credenciales
description.content:
El designado embajador de Ecuador en Colombia, Raúl Vallejo, presentará hoy en Bogotá sus credenciales ante el Gobierno colombiano, tras el restablecimiento pleno de las relaciones diplomáticas entre ambos países, en un acto al que también asistirá el canciller ecuatoriano Ricardo Patiño.
Una fuente del Ministerio de Relaciones Exteriores en Quito confirmó a Efe que Patiño y Vallejo se reunirán mañana en la tarde con la canciller colombiana María Ángela Holguín, para presentarle las respectivas cartas de acreditación.
La fuente comentó que ambos funcionarios ecuatorianos también mantendrán reuniones en la sede de la embajada de Ecuador en Bogotá para definir las líneas de trabajo de la legación diplomática.
Vallejo viajará a Bogotá hacia las 06.00 hora local (11.00 GMT), mientras que Patiño lo hará unas cinco horas más tarde, precisó la fuente.
El nuevo embajador regresará a Quito mañana mismo en la noche y prevé volver a la capital colombiana el próximo 5 de enero, después de las fiestas de Navidad y Año Nuevo, para ocupar su nuevo cargo.
La designación de Vallejo marca la etapa final del proceso de normalización de las relaciones diplomáticas entre ambos países, rotas desde marzo de 2008 a raíz de un ataque militar colombiano contra un campamento guerrillero de las FARC instalado clandestinamente en suelo ecuatoriano.
Dicho bombardeo fue considerado por Ecuador como una violación a su soberanía.
Vallejo, en declaraciones difundidas ayer por la Cancillería ecuatoriana, también indicó que ha mantenido varias reuniones para fortalecer algunos capítulos de la relación bilateral como soberanía, refugiados, convenios binacionales y cultura, entre otras áreas.
Sobre la presencia en Ecuador de miles de desplazados colombianos por la violencia, el diplomático dijo que presentará en Colombia “una visión humanitaria y humanista de estas personas.El designado embajador de Ecuador en Colombia, Raúl Vallejo, presentará hoy en Bogotá sus credenciales ante el Gobierno colombiano, tras el restablecimiento pleno de las relaciones diplomáticas.

description.hltext_display: 22.12.2010 09:26 Beihilfe zur Steuerhinterziehung Deutsche Bank kauft sich mit halber Milliarde Dollar frei
description.content:
Die Deutsche Bank muss den USA wegen Beihilfe zur Steuerhinterziehung nach Angaben der amerikanischen Justiz rund 550 Millionen Dollar (418 Millionen Euro) zahlen. Im Gegenzug verzichten die US-Behörden auf Strafverfolgung und stellen die Ermittlungen ein.
Die illegalen Steuersparmodelle für Kunden, in die das Kreditinstitut verwickelt gewesen sei, sollen zu milliardenschweren Ausfällen für den US-Staat beigetragen haben.
Die USA haben die Deutsche Bank für ihre Beteiligung an illegalen Steuersparmodellen zur Rechenschaft gezogen. Das Frankfurter Geldhaus willigte ein, knapp 554 Millionen Dollar an den amerikanischen Fiskus zu zahlen. Im Gegenzug würde der Fall nicht weiter verfolgt, teilte die US-Bundesstaatsanwaltschaft in Manhattan am Dienstag mit.
Die Deutsche Bank habe kriminelles Fehlverhalten eingestanden, hieß es in der gemeinsamen Mitteilung der Staatsanwaltschaft und der Steuerbehörde IRS. Die illegalen Steuersparmodelle für Kunden, in die das Kreditinstitut verwickelt gewesen sei, hätten zu milliardenschweren Ausfällen für den Staat beigetragen.
Die Fälle liegen nach Angaben der Deutschen Bank allerdings schon Jahre zurück - von 1996 bis 2002. Die Bank habe ihre Richtlinien und Verfahren seitdem wesentlich verschärft, teilte das Kreditinstitut mit. Im Rahmen der sogenannten Nichtverfolgungsvereinbarung muss sie ihre internen Mechanismen weiter verfeinern.
Ein unabhängiger Experte überwacht, dass sich die Deutsche Bank nichts mehr zuschulden kommen lässt. Zudem muss die Bank von Zeit zu Zeit Bericht an die US-Behörden erstatten. Steuersparmodelle, die den kritisierten ähnlich sind, sind für die Frankfurter künftig komplett tabu.
Finanziell hat die Deutsche Bank vorgesorgt. Sie bildete nach eigenen Angaben in der Vergangenheit ausreichende Rückstellungen, „so dass der zu zahlende Betrag keine Auswirkungen auf das laufende Ergebnis nach Steuern haben wird". Immer wieder hatte die Deutsche Bank in ihren Finanzberichten vage auf Steuerermittlungsverfahren in den USA hingewiesen.

description.hltext_display: Israeli Lawyer Fights the �99 Agorot� Prices
description.content:
Follow Israel news on and .
Anyone who does any shopping in Israel is familiar with the stores' "bargain prices" of 19.99 shekels or 99.95 shekels.
The problem is that one cannot receive change if paying 20 shekels for a product which costs 19.99 shekels, since the one agora coin has not been produced in Israel for many years. The same goes for the five agorot coin which has not been in use since 2008. For the same reasons, one obviously cannot pay exact change, which leads to rounding of prices.
But Israeli attorney Ofer Shahal has had enough of prices being rounded due to non-existent coins, and he has decided to fight this phenomenon. Shahal recently sent a letter to Minister of Industry, Trade and Labor Binyamin Ben-Eliezer, in which he demanded that the Ministry forbid the use of coins which have been cancelled, be it through legislation or through announcing a ban on such usage. Shahal also wrote that should nothing be done in the matter, he will turn to Israel’s High Court.
“We are all consumers and we are very familiar with all the shops that on a daily basis offer the price of NIS '19 .99'; '49 .99'; or at best, '19 .95 '; '99 .95'; and the like,” wrote Shahal in the letter which was quoted by Globes. “We don’t get change! We cannot get change, because the agora and five agorot coins have been put out of use through the Bank of Israel's orders.”
Shahal complains in his letter that by doing nothing to eliminate these prices, the Ministry of Industry, Trade and Labor gives legitimacy to retailers to make cynical use of coins which do not exist.
While he acknowledges that the “99 agorot” phenomenon is something which was adopted in Israel from overseas countries, Shahal points out that, unlike in Israel, in other countries the consumer always receives change even to the smallest penny.
Shahal claims that continued use of non-existent coins is nothing short of deception which is prohibited by the Consumer Protection Act. “The situation today in Israel is that consumers are misled with a permit from the government,” says Shahal and concludes, “This is an improper policy and it is very easy to rectify the situation” and if this is not done, he warns "he will go to the High Court.”
In response to Shahal’s claims, the Ministry of Industry, Trade and Labor told Globes: "The Ministry filed on August 12, 2010, an application to amend the Consumer Protection Act, which states that it is prohibited to present prices using non-legal tender. The bill is being debated by the Justice Ministry.”

description.hltext_display: [O2/뮤직]케이팝 인더스트리-⑥축구 칼럼니스트 ‘존 듀어든’
Emaar Faces Games Payout
description.content: Emaar's Indian venture is still staring at a $20 million fine for alleged delays in the construction of the recent Commonwealth Games athletes village, after Dehli High Court rejected a plea by the developer.

description.hltext_display: “北관리들 뇌물도 中위안, 美달러 선호”
description.content: 북한에서 시장 거래뿐 아니라 뇌물로도 중국 위안화와 미국 달러화가 북한의 원화보다 선호될 정도로 외화 사용이 일반화됐다고 대북 인권단체 '좋은벗들'이 22일 전했다.이 단체는 소식지에서 '북한 현지 소식통'을 인용해 "청진 수남시장, 함흥 추평시장, 신의주 채하시장, 혜산 신흥시장 등 주요 시장에서 웬만한 상품은 인민폐나 달러화로 거래하고 있다"면서 "소소한 물건값은 북한 돈으로 매길 때도 있지만 북한 돈으로 10만원 이상인 물건값은 인민폐나 달러로 받는다"고 밝혔다.이 단체에 따르면 시장 소매상도 물건값을 물어보면 달러나 위안화로 말하는 경우가 많아져, 쌀 한 포대가 얼마냐고 물으면 보통 위안화로 계산해 '100원'이라고 말하고 있다.

description.hltext_display: Lautopsie confirme lhypothèse Coralie
description.content: Ce nest encore quune hypothèse, que seule pourra confirmer une comparaison des profils ADN. Mais les premiers résultats de lautopsie du corps décomposé retrouvé dimanche après-midi à Port-Saint-Louis-du Rhône nont pas permis décarter la piste de Coralie Moussu. Au contraire : des éléments concordants ont été découverts dans lexamen dentaire de ce corps féminin, qui a séjourné au moins six mois dans leau, et celui de cette mère de famille de 32 ans, recherchée depuis le 6 novembre 2009 à Vénéjan, près de Pont-Saint-Esprit (Gard). Pour ses proches, qui remuent ciel et terre depuis plus dun an pour retrouver Coralie, lattente devient insoutenable.« Il faut rester prudent, car on ne peut avoir encore aucune certitude. Mais on a des comparatifs dentaires qui montrent des ressemblances sur certains points. » Christian Pasta, le procureur de la République de Tarascon, reste circonspect après lautopsie du corps décomposé retrouvé dimanche en fin daprès-midi à un kilomètre en amont de Port-Saint-Louis-du-Rhône. Le cadavre a été examiné en détail hier après-midi à Marseille par un médecin légiste. « Il ny a aucun élément permettant détablir les circonstances de la mort : pas de choc traumatique, de traces visibles de coups, de plaies », précise le magistrat. « Le légiste estime dailleurs quil ne pourra pas déterminer les causes du décès. Seule certitude, le corps a séjourné au moins six mois dans leau. »En revanche, létude des dents oriente les enquêteurs vers lhypothèse Coralie Moussu : « Il y a des soins dentaires sur deux dents qui pourraient correspondre avec des soins quavait subis la disparue de Pont-Saint-Esprit », poursuit le procureur de Tarascon. « Mais il faut attendre la confirmation des analyses ADN, car il peut y avoir beaucoup de personnes qui ont subi des soins similaires. »Les gendarmes de la section de recherches de Nîmes, qui ont créé en mars dernier une cellule de cinq enquêteurs mobilisés sur la disparition de Coralie Moussu, se sont vu remettre un scellé afin de pouvoir en extraire le profil génétique du cadavre du Rhône. Il devait être confié à un laboratoire, afin de pouvoir effectuer un comparatif avec celui de la disparue. « Aujourdhui, ce genre dopération prend moins de 48 heures, on devrait savoir cela très vite », indique une source proche de lenquête.Dici là, les enquêteurs notent que ce corps est le premier à être rendu par le Rhône depuis la disparition de Coralie, et quil sagit bien dun corps féminin. La piste dune autre femme, disparue dans le secteur de Tarascon à la fin de lété, est également écartée, le corps retrouvé dimanche étant resté immergé beaucoup plus longtemps. Par ailleurs, le niveau du Rhône est particulièrement haut depuis plusieurs jours, ce qui pourrait avoir joué dans la réapparition de ce cadavre. « Sil sagit bien du corps de Coralie Moussu, le dossier sera transmis au juge dinstruction nîmois qui en est chargé », conclut le procureur Pasta. « Sil sagit dune autre personne, nous allons ouvrir une enquête pour déterminer les causes de la mort, et il va falloir travailler pour parvenir à identifier cette personne. » François BARRÈRE

description.hltext_display: KP plays down verbals
description.content:
England firebrand Kevin Pietersen says the alleged verbal barrage from Australia throughout the third Test was tame by Ashes standards.
Much has been made of Australia's increased sledging in Perth after several spot fires broke out over the four days.
Paceman Peter Siddle and England batsman Matt Prior enjoyed a heated exchange, while Mitchell Johnson was also involved in several verbal stoushes with the tourists as Australia levelled the series at 1-1 with an emphatic 267-run victory.
But Pietersen insists the mood at the WACA was no different to the opening two Tests in Brisbane and Adelaide, and a far cry from the previous three Ashes series he's been involved in.
'I think you guys (the media) feed them some good lines and they talk a lot don't they,' Pietersen quipped on Wednesday.
'Nothing's different. I don't see anything different at all.'
'I played against Australia I don't know how many Test matches now (15) and believe me, the first time I played against Australia and the second time out here with the likes of (Shane) Warne, (Glenn) McGrath etc, etc, there were some pretty big verbal contests.'
'But no, I haven't seen or heard anything different (in Perth) to anything that's happened in the first two Test matches, let alone last year in England.'
'There's not really any big chirpers or sledgers (in the current Australian team).'
'It's just England versus Australia,' he said.
'It's an Ashes series, blokes get a little bit red-misted occasionally, and you're allowed to do that on both teams - things happen.'
'We're playing for that little urn, it's historic, it's huge.'
Pietersen is adamant the tourists have put the disappointment of Perth behind them, as they look to retain the Ashes with a win in either Melbourne or Sydney.
'I think we're all disappointed with what happened last week but we're excited about this week's challenges.'
'We're 1-1 going into a Melbourne Test match (in front of) 100,000 people, if you're not excited then I don't reckon you should be doing what we do.'
The 30-year-old openly admitted Johnson's blistering spell on day two 'took us by surprise', but warned the Poms will be better prepared come Boxing Day.
'We knew he could swing it but we didn't realise he could swing it that much,' he said.
'He obviously did some really good work in the week that he had off, but we're going to be a lot better prepared for it here in Melbourne, so we'll play him a lot better.'
Asked if believes the rumours Australia have instructed the MCG curator to prepare a spicy wicket in the wake of their Perth success, Pietersen warned the hosts to tread carefully.
'Of course they're going to do it, they've just had success in Perth, but we've had success around the world on bouncy wickets,' he said.
'We lost that Test match within half an hour at 5-20, that's where we lost that Test match with full swinging balls that knocked over our top order.'
'We didn't lose the Test match to a bouncy wicket ... so I don't think the wicket's going to play any different part.'
Meanwhile, Pietersen is convinced Australian captain Ricky Ponting will play despite a nursing a broken little finger on his left hand, while he also confirmed England quick James Anderson will play despite suffering a side strain in Perth.
'I've played a full series against Sri Lanka with a broken small finger so I don't see it as a big deal,' he said.

event_or_fact.property: ve had success around the world on bouncy wickets

description.hltext_display: Statement After Adoption by the General Assembly of a US-led Amendment to the Resolution on Extrajudicial, Summary, and Arbitrary Executions
description.content:
Today, the United Nations General Assembly has sent a clear and resounding message that justice and human rights apply to all individuals regardless of their sexual orientation.
Several weeks ago, on November 16, the General Assembly’s Third Committee voted by a narrow margin to eliminate any mention of lesbian, gay, bisexual, and transgender individuals from a resolution condemning extrajudicial killing of vulnerable people around the world. The United States fought hard for that reference when it came to a Committee vote, and we lost. As I have said before, I was incensed by that vote.
In the weeks following that setback, the United States was proud to introduce an amendment to restore this critical language to the biennial resolution on Extrajudicial, Summary, and Arbitrary Execution before it came for a final vote of the full UN General Assembly. On December 10, at an event marking Human Rights Day, I announced our effort and said, “We’re going to stand firm on this basic principle, and we intend to win.”
The U.S built a broad coalition of partners and together we galvanized member states to support this effort – and to win.
Today, the General Assembly voted by a significant margin, 93 to 55, to approve the U.S.-led amendment and condemn the extrajudicial killing of people around the world due to their sexual orientation.
The voices of civil society and human rights defenders around the world have been heard today, and for that my delegation is especially proud. Less than two weeks after we celebrated the 62nd anniversary of the Universal Declaration of Human Rights, today’s vote ensures that the principles enshrined in that Declaration are put into practice – and indeed live on – in the 21st Century.

article.source: US Embassy U.S. Mission to the U.N.-New York

entity.property: the 62nd anniversary of the Universal Declaration of Human Rights
General Assembly of a US-led Amendment

description.hltext_display: SMOOTH SKATING
교황청 “교황, 피임용 콘돔 승인 안 해”
description.content: 교황 베네딕토 16세의 "특수한 경우에 한해 콘돔 사용을 허락할 수 있다"는 최근 발언과 관련, 교황청이 교황은 피임을 목적으로 한 콘돔 사용을 승인한 게 아니라고 해명했다.22일 영국 BBC 등 외신에 따르면 교황청의 신앙교리성(CDF)은 성명을 통해 지난달 교황이 인터뷰에서 한 발언을 일부 분석가들이 곡해하고 있다고 밝혔다.CDF는 가톨릭 신앙과 윤리 도덕에 대한 교리를 증진, 보존하는 역할을 하는 최고 기관으로서 교황 베네딕토 16세가 2005년 즉위하기 전 추기경 시절에 이 기관의 책임자를 맡았었다.교황 베네딕토 16세는 출간 예정인 한 서적에서 "에이즈 바이러스(HIV) 감염이라는 '악'에 대처하는 데 콘돔을 사용하는 게 현실적이고 도덕적 방법은 아니지만, 남성 매춘부에 의한 콘돔 사용은 '교화의 첫 걸음'이 될 수 있다"고 말했다.이러한 교황의 발언을 서적 발간 이전에 교황청 일간지가 발췌, 소개하면서 교황청이 그간의 태도를 바꿔 콘돔 사용을 허용하는 것 아니냐는 해석을 낳아 논란이 빚어졌다.CDF는 성명에서 "교황의 논리는 가톨릭 교회의 도덕적, 신앙적 전통에 부합한다"며 "교황의 발언을 가지고 '원하지 않는 임신을 피하고자 콘돔을 사용할 수도 있다'고 추론하는 것은 다분히 자의적인 해석으로 절대 정당화할 수 없다"고 못박았다.

description.hltext_display: Mosley Could Break $7 Million Mark in Pacquiao Bout
description.author: Lem Satterfield
description.content:
By Lem Satterfield
On May 7 at the MGM Grand in Las Vegas, Manny Pacquiao will defend his WBO welterweight title against Shane Mosley. Pacquiao (52-3-2, 38 KOs), who won the WBC junior middleweight belt, is his last ring appearance, will head back to welterweight. Mosley was chosen over WBO/WBA lightweight king Juan Manuel Marquez (51-5-1, 38 KOs) and WBC welterweight belt-holder Andre Berto (27-0, 21 KOs).Mosley confirmed that his purse, up front, stands to be around $5 million against Pacquiao. But with incentives, Mosley could wind up earning a career-high amount, surpassing the previous career-best of $7 million that he pocketed after his unanimous decision loss to Floyd Mayweather (41-0, 25 KOs) back in May, who received a non-heavyweight record guarantee of $22.5 million."That's still accurate. We came to an agreement with everything involved, including the financial end of it," Mosley said of the numbers pertaining to his purse.
Lem Satterfield is the boxing editor at AOL FanHouse and the news editor at BoxingScene.com. To read more from Lem Satterfield, go to AOL FanHouse by Clicking Here.

description.hltext_display: 22.12.2010 09:36 ARD will wieder senden Deutsche Soldaten in Afghanistan können wieder „Tagesschau" sehen
description.content:
Nach Kritik an der Abschaltung ihres Programms für die Soldaten in Afghanistan will die ARD den Sendebetrieb wieder aufnehmen. Zuvor hatten der Bundeswehrverband, der Wehrbeauftragte und mehrere Politiker die ARD für das Abschalten aus Kostengründen kritisiert.
Aus Kostengründen hatte die ARD im Juli die Übertragungen nach Afghanistan abgeschaltet.
„In einer Blitzaktion" sei es gelungen, eine Sondervereinbarung mit dem Satelliten-Betreiber SES-Astra in Luxemburg abzuschließen, teilte der ARD-Vorsitzende Peter Boudgoust am Dienstag in Stuttgart mit. Damit könnten die Soldaten noch vor Weihnachten wieder das ARD-Programm empfangen, das bereits im Juni aus Kostengründen abgeschaltet worden war. „Wir hatten bereits geraume Zeit nach Lösungen für dieses komplexe juristische Problem gesucht", sagte Boudgoust. Jetzt sei eine kostenneutrale Lösung gefunden worden.
Bundesverteidigungsminister Karl Theodor zu Guttenberg (CSU) begrüßte die Entscheidung. „Ich danke der ARD für diese unbürokratische Entscheidung", sagte er der „Bild"-Zeitung (Mittwochausgabe). „So rückt unseren Soldaten im Einsatz die Heimat über die Festtage ein kleines Stück näher." Auch der Intendant des MDR, Udo Reiter, zeigte sich erleichtert: „Unsere Soldaten in Afghanistan sollten selbstverständlich Zugang zu möglichst vielen Fernsehsendungen aus der Heimat haben."
Zuvor hatten der Bundeswehrverband, der Wehrbeauftragte und mehrere Politiker die ARD für das Abschalten kritisiert. „Die ARD sendet ihr Programm nicht mehr, dafür aber ein sehr unschönes Signal an alle Menschen in der Bundeswehr", sagte der stellvertretende Bundesvorsitzende der Soldatenvereinigung, Wolfgang Schmelzer, in Bonn. Der Ausstrahlungsstopp erschwere den essenziellen Kontakt der Truppe in die Heimat. Er zeigte sich optimistisch, dass die ARD ihr Vorgehen überdenken werde.
Der Wehrbeauftragte des Bundestages, Hellmut Königshaus (FDP), sagte der „Bild"-Zeitung (Dienstag): „Es ist ein Unding, wie die ARD mit unseren Soldatinnen und Soldaten in Afghanistan umgeht. Das ist nicht akzeptabel. Etwas Patriotismus würde einer öffentlich- rechtlichen Sendeanstalt schon gut tun." SPD-Fraktionschef Frank- Walter Steinmeier kritisierte in der „Bild"-Zeitung: „Das kann doch wohl nicht wahr sein, dass man den Soldaten im gefährlichen Auslandseinsatz das TV-Programm abdreht."
Guttenberg hatte am Montag gesagt: „Die Soldaten wären sicher dankbar, wenn die ARD einige Sendeformate wie die Tagesschau oder regionale Sendungen zur Verfügung stellen könnte, damit wir diese ins Einsatzgebiet übertragen." Aus der CDU kam ebenfalls Unterstützung. Verteidigungsexperte Ernst-Reinhard Beck: „Die Soldaten zahlen ihre GEZ-Gebühren wie alle anderen auch. Es ist daher mehr als ärgerlich, dass sie aus Kostengründen vom Programm ausgeschlossen werden.

description.hltext_display: Hasta enero habrá ‘cachinerías’
description.content:
Tras dos semanas de ausencia en Guayaquil, el presidente de la República, Rafael Correa, retomó sus visitas de los martes al Puerto Principal. Los sitios de venta de artículos de segunda mano, donde además supuestamente se negocia con cosas robadas, fueron uno de los puntos que el Jefe de Estado recorrió y para los cuales tuvo un anuncio.
“He dado un plazo hasta el mes de enero para que se acaben estos negocios ilícitos (venta de artículos robados), pues sino tendré que tomar las medidas del caso en todos sus órdenes”, señaló y recordó una reforma al Código Penal (art. 569) que tipifica como delito la venta e intercambio de elementos robados o cuya procedencia no se puede justificar.
En el habitual conversatorio con los medios de comunicación de la urbe, Correa agregó que existen trabas en la aplicación de esa reforma, elaborada hace dos años y medio. La sanción para quienes incurran en ese ilícito, destacó el Mandatario, es la reclusión menor ordinaria de tres a seis años más el pago de 16 dólares.
Pero, lamentó que por un recurso de amparo concedido por el juez Tercero de Garantías penales del Azuay, Jaime Vintimilla, está bloqueada la parte medular del artículo 569, que permite la detención de quien vende artículos de dudosa procedencia y no puede justificar su origen.
“Lo que se tiene que probar es que el denunciante tiene la razón al decir que lo que se está vendiendo le fue sustraído”, deploró.
Ese mensaje fue el que llevó a los locales ubicados desde el sector de las avenidas Manabí, Machala, Pedro Montúfar, Pedro Moncayo y a quienes atienden puestos en el Mercado de Artículos Varios, conocido también como de las cuatro manzanas.
“Compañeros, ustedes deben ser los primeros en denunciar si les vienen a ofrecer cosas robadas, si no hay justificación para lo que ustedes ofrecen”, les explicó a Hugo Quiñónez y José Yagual, quienes recibieron en su local al Jefe de Estado cerca de las 10 de la mañana.
Mientras eso ocurría, cientos de conductores que circulaban por la avenida Quito pitaban incansablemente porque tres agentes de la Comisión de Tránsito del Guayas (CTG) detuvieron el flujo vehicular para que el Presidente recorra los negocios apostados a lo largo de la calle Manabí.
Hasta que llegó al mercado, construido por el Municipio de Guayaquil. La presencia de Correa congregó a cientos de curiosos. “Ya mismo llega (Jaime) Nebot, para recibirlo”, bromeó alguien y las risas no se hicieron esperar.
Ya en el recinto, donde comerciantes ofrecen desde tornillos, herramientas, ropa y cualquier clase de artículo, especialmente de segunda mano, Correa siguió con la recomendación que dio a Quiñónez y a Yagual cuadras atrás.
Hasta que llegó a una esquina donde, sobre un improvisado mostrador en el que había unas 15 gatas hidráulicas. “¿Quién atiende aquí?, ¿dónde está la persona que vende estas gatas?”, preguntó a los otros comerciantes, aunque no recibió respuesta alguna, por lo que dispuso a Julio César Quiñónez, intendente del Guayas, buscar a ese dependiente.
Luego de que el Presidente abandonó ese lugar la Policía detuvo a cuatro personas que no pudieron justificar el origen de la mercadería que ofrecían.
El siguiente punto en la agenda presidencial fue el edificio del desaparecido Banco Continental, ubicado en las calles Víctor Manuel Rendón entre General Córdova y Pedro Carbo, y que el Ejecutivo dispuso se efectúen los trámites para que el inmueble sea traspasado a la Fiscalía del Guayas.
La sorpresa para Correa fue encontrar la edificación, de 14 pisos, vacía y con las puertas cerradas. “Hace dos años y dos meses que entregamos este edificio a la Fiscalía y no han hecho nada”, cuestionó. Eran las 10:50 de la mañana y Washington Pesántez, fiscal general, y quien había invitado a una reunión a Correa, no había llegado al punto de encuentro.
Diez minutos más tarde, arribó el titular del Ministerio Público e inició el cónclave en el que participaron los nuevos miembros del gabinete ministerial, Alfredo Vera (del Interior) y Homero Arellano (coordinador de Seguridad Interna y Externa), además de Diego Borja, presidente del directorio del Banco Central del Ecuador.
“Antes del viernes, el edificio ya es de la Fiscalía y para marzo esperamos ponerlo en funcionamiento”, destacó Correa en el conversatorio.
La parte relajada de la visita presidencial tuvo su lugar en el Parque Histórico, donde unos 60 niños recibieron un agasajo navideño que incluyó un almuerzo y entrega de juguetes. Pasadas las 16:00, el Jefe de Estado se reunió con el Consejo de Seguridad para analizar esa problemática.El Jefe de Estado anunció que a pesar de que existe un amparo constitucional, no se podrán expender artículos que no justifiquen su origen.

description.hltext_display: Harry Gross: Call asking personal data raises reader's suspicion
description.author: Harry Gross
description.content:
Dear Harry: This is roughly the conversation I had last Friday with a young woman who called me and identified herself as a representative of my prescription insurance company.
She: Mr. X, I am Jane Smith and I'm in the process of checking our records on your account. We need to verify your Social Security number and date of birth. Could you please give them to me?
Me: If you give me your information, I will verify their correctness. (I am suspicious.)
She: That would be a violation of our privacy rules, and I'm not permitted to do that.
Me: (Now very suspicious.) Then I'll call you back at the company's number. What is your extension?
She: I cannot be reached through our regular switchboard. I'll give you my direct line number.
Me: No dice. How about if you give me three or four SS numbers, and I'll tell you which is correct?
She: Sorry. Privacy rules don't permit that.
Me: My privacy rules don't permit any other way.
She: You know, your stubbornness will delay any shipments to you. I will not call again.
Do you think this was a scam?
What Harry says: I have no idea, but I'm at least as suspicious as you are. You may get a follow-up letter with a return envelope. Before you reply, check out the address with a call to the company's regular switchboard. It's better to be wrong about your suspicions 100 times than to be careless just once.
Write Harry Gross c/o the Daily News, 400 N. Broad St., Philadelphia, PA 19130. Harry urges all his readers to give blood - contact the American Red Cross at 800-Red Cross.

event_or_fact.property: I have no idea, but I'm at least as suspicious as you are
all his readers to give blood - contact the American Red Cross at 800-Red Cross

description.hltext_display: Fight looms after Texas gets 4 new US House seats
description.content:
A surge of Hispanic residents and other population gains have Texas poised to add more congressional clout than any other state, but a partisan fight now looms over exactly where the new seats should go.
Texas is gaining four seats in the U.S. House, twice as many as Florida, the only other state to pick up multiple ones, according to new population figures announced Tuesday by the U.S. Census Bureau. All told, Republican-leaning states will pick up at least a half dozen House seats thanks to the 2010 census, which found the nation's population growing more slowly than in past decades but still shifting to the South and West.
With Texas Republicans using recent elections to fortify their already solid control of the state Legislature, the political process of redrawing the state's congressional map would seem to benefit the GOP, too.
But Democrats say not so fast.
Boyd Richie, chairman of the Texas Democratic Party, said Hispanic and black population growth account for the additional seats, and he vowed to fight for a redistricting plan that takes their numbers into account.
"A legal and fair redistricting process must produce new congressional districts that reflect the Hispanic and African American population growth," Richie said. "Our Democratic numbers may be down, but we are not out. Democrats cannot and will not allow our voices to be silenced in this critical process."
The Census Bureau said the nation's population on April 1 was 308,745,538, up from 281.4 million a decade ago. The growth rate for the past decade was 9.7 percent, the lowest since the Great Depression. The U.S. population grew by 13.2 percent from 1990 to 2000. Michigan was the only state to lose population during the past decade. Nevada, with a 35 percent increase, was the fastest-growing state.
The new numbers are a boon for Republicans, with Texas leading the way among GOP-leaning states that will gain House seats, mostly at the Rust Belt's expense. Following each once-a-decade census, the nation must reapportion the House's 435 districts to make them roughly equal in population, with each state getting at least one seat.
In all, the census figures show a shift affecting 18 states taking effect when the 113th Congress takes office in 2013. The political power follows the high population growth, shifting toward the south and west and away from the industrial Midwest and northeast.
With reapportionment settled, the far more politically divisive process of redistricting is set to begin. In Texas, both major parties were bracing for a showdown over the state's new residents, beginning a fight that is sure to spark court action. But with Republican supermajorities in the Legislature, the temptation to run the table will be strong.
Rep. Pete Gallego, D-Alpine, said if the federal courts don't intervene to compel fairness, Republicans will likely produce a map that gives their party the advantage in three or perhaps even all four of the new seats.
"It is very easy to overreach when you're holding the map and have the pen in your hand," he said.
Despite the party's recent gains in the November legislative elections, Republicans won't have unchecked authority to draw the state's congressional map to benefit themselves.
Civil rights laws require that the interests of minority voters be protected as district boundaries are redrawn, and Texas is one of the states whose redistricting plans require "pre-clearance" by federal authorities under the Voting Rights Act.
Democrats are also counting on an assist from the Obama administration, which could have a significant voice in the pre-clearance process. It is the first time since the Voting Rights Act passed that the Justice Department will be in Democratic hands during the redistricting process.
Hispanic growth doesn't automatically translate into Democratic growth, though. Two heavily Hispanic congressional seats in South Texas flipped to Republicans this year. There also are several new Latino GOP members about to be sworn into legislative seats.
South Texas Rep. Aaron Pena, who recently left the Democrat Party and became a Republican, said Texas Latinos are more conservative than their counterparts in western states such as California and Nevada.
Pena, who sits on the House Redistricting Committee, said his "educated guess" was that Republicans would get three of the four seats.
"The Hispanic community is increasingly up for grabs," Pena said. "It's truly a swing population."
Texas already had the largest Republican delegation in Congress, holding 20 of the state's 32 seats. In the 2010 elections, the party picked up another three seats, two of them in heavily Latino districts in South Texas. With all the new growth, Texas will now have 36 seats and 38 presidential electoral votes.
Federal lawsuits are essentially guaranteed as part of the process, and if the past is any guide, the courts will have a major say in how the lines are finally drawn. In 2001, the Texas Legislature deadlocked on Congressional redistricting, leaving the federal courts to redraw all the districts. In 2006, the U.S. Supreme Court ordered that new lines be drawn in several districts to protect the rights of Hispanic voters in South Texas.
Starting early next year, most state governments will use detailed, computer-generated data on voting patterns to carve neighborhoods in or out of newly drawn House districts, tilting them more to the left or right. Sometimes politicians play it safe, quietly agreeing to protect Republican and Democratic incumbents alike. But sometimes the party in control will gamble and aggressively try to reconfigure the map to dump as many opponents as possible.
The U.S. is still growing quickly relative to other developed nations. The population in France and England each increased roughly 5 percent over the past decade, while in Japan the number is largely unchanged, and Germany's population is declining. China grew at about 6 percent; Canada's growth rate is roughly 10 percent.
The 2010 census results also are used to distribute more than $400 billion in annual federal aid and will change each state's Electoral College votes beginning in the 2012 presidential election.
Apart from the respective four- and two-seat gains in Texas and Florida, Arizona, Georgia, Nevada, South Carolina, Utah and Washington are all picking up one new U.S. House seat. Ohio and New York will lose two House seats each. Losing one House seat are Illinois, Iowa, Louisiana, Massachusetts, Michigan, Missouri, New Jersey and Pennsylvania.
Each House district represents an electoral vote in the presidential election process, meaning the political map for the 2012 election will tilt somewhat more Republican.

description.hltext_display: S. Korea denies responsibility in sinking of Chinese boat
description.author: YONHAP
description.content: SEOUL, Dec. 22 (Yonhap) -- South Korea was legitimately enforcing a law on suspected illegal fishing when a Chinese fishing boat sank in the Yellow Sea last week after colliding with a South Korean patrol vessel, an official said Wednesday. South Korea also has a video and other evidence clearly showing that the Chinese boat slammed into a South Korean Coast Guard vessel, apparently deliberately, before sinking, and the country is willing to allow China to view ...

description.hltext_display: Jeune femme battue avec une batte de base-ball : garde à vue prolongée pour l'agresseur
description.content: Publié à 7 h - Mis à jour à 9 h 45 - Dimanche après- midi, une jeune femme a été battue à coups de batte de base-ball L'enquête sur l'agression sauvage qui s'est produite, dimanche après-midi, à Pont-Saint-Esprit, s'est poursuivie hier avec le prolongement de la garde à vue du suspect. Il s'agit du compagnon, âgé de 29 ans, de cette jeune Spiripontaine de 28 ans. Elle se trouve au Centre hospitalier régional universitaire (CHRU) de Montpellier dans un état jugé très critique. Retour sur les faits.Les causes de ce déchaînement de violence seraient liées à l'annonce d'une fin de relation entre les deux jeunes gens. L'homme n'aurait pas supporté cette situation.Il aurait d'abord porté des coups avec ses mains. Dans un second temps, il se serait emparé d'une batte de base-ball avec laquelle il a frappé à plusieurs reprises sa compagne, avant de l'abandonner à son sort. L'homme aurait ensuite regagné son domicile situé en Ardèche. Puis, pris de remords et retrouvant manifestement ses esprits, l'agresseur a téléphoné aux gendarmes de Privas (proche de son logement) pour les prévenir de l'acte qu'il venait de commettre.En même temps qu'il était en contact avec les militaires ardéchois, son interpellation était réalisée. L'homme n'aurait opposé aucune résistance à son arrestation. Assez vite, il était transféré dans les locaux de la brigade de recherches de Bagnols-sur-Cèze où il était placé en garde à vue et interrogé sur les circonstances de l'affaire. Le suspect aurait reconnu les faits. Le passage à l'acte serait donc lié à la rupture que la jeune femme venait d'annoncer.Hier après-midi, le parquet de Nîmes a ordonné la prolongation de la garde à vue de l'agresseur afin de poursuivre les interrogatoires jusqu'à son défèrement, prévu aujourd'hui, au parquet de Nîmes où une information judiciaire devrait être ouverte et le dossier confié à un juge d'instruction. Les faits reprochés pourraient être de nature criminelle.L'évolution de l'état de santé de la Spiripontaine sera déterminante. Selon nos informations, la malheureuse serait entre la vie et la mort et les données médicales seraient pessimistes.Les médecins auraient engagé le diagnostic vital mais une phase de plusieurs jours sera nécessaire pour poser avec davantage de précisions les chances de survie de cette jeune femme. Hocine ROUAGDIA hrouagdia@midilibre.com

description.hltext_display: Fondi Ue a imprese hi-tech
description.content:
Finanziamenti Ue alle imprese innovative delle Regioni Convergenza: 915 milioni di fondi MIUR nell'ambito del PON Ricerca e Competitività 2007/2013.
Ammonta a 915 milioni di euro lo stanziamento previsto dal Ministero dell'Istruzione, Università e Ricerca (MIUR) nell'ambito del PON Ricerca e Competitività 2007/2013 per finanziare le imprese hi-tech delle "Regioni Convergenza": Calabria, Campania, Puglia e Sicilia.
Si tratta di fondi Ue Ue per promuovere lo sviluppo scientifico e tecnologico del territorio, la creazione di nuove partnership pubblico-private, potenziando quelle già esistenti.
Il bando si rivolge alle imprese che intendano avviare progetti tecnologici volti a garantire una crescita competitiva e strutturale del quadro sociale, economico ed industriale. In particolare saranno destinati 389 milioni di euro per lo sviluppo e potenziamento di Distretti e Laboratori già esistenti e 526 milioni di euro per la creazione di nuovi Distretti e Aggregazioni.
Distretti e Aggregazioni prevedono necessariamente il coinvolgimento di imprese, università ed istituzioni di ricerca, guidate da uno specifico organo di governo.
Per Laboratori Pubblico-Privati si intende invece «un insieme aggregato e organico di attività di ricerca fondamentale, industriale e sviluppo sperimentale, che contempla la partecipazione congiunta di atenei, imprese ed enti pubblici di ricerca per il perseguimento di obiettivi scientifico-tecnologici sia di breve-medio periodo sia di medio-lungo termine».
Il finanziamento coprirà i costi legati alle attività di ricerca industriale, di sviluppo sperimentale e di formazione nella forma del contributo alla spesa. Sono previste maggiorazioni in caso di coinvolgimento di Pmi, o di organismi di ricerca, o di collaborazione tra le imprese. Per progetti di formazione l'agevolazione potrà arrivare a coprire il 100% del costo ammissibile.
L'importo complessivo delle spese ammissibili non deve essere inferiore ai 5 milioni di euro, né superiore ai 25 milioni.
Alle domande di partecipazione, che potranno essere inviate fino alle ore 12 del 15 febbraio 2011, dovrà essere allegato un Piano di sviluppo Strategico, sotto forma di documento programmatico della durata minima di cinque anni, insieme ad almeno due progetti di ricerca industriale con attività di formazione professionale di ricercatori e tecnici di ricerca. Per i progetti legati alla creazione di nuovi distretti e Laboratori, è necessario anche uno Studio di fattibilità.

description.hltext_display: Pillos ‘floristas’ intentan robar
description.content:
La Policía sorprendió y capturó a cinco integrantes de una banda de malhechores que asaltaba una vivienda en la ciudadela Urdesa, calles Circunvalación Sur entre Jiguas e Ilanes, en el norte de Guayaquil.
El grupo delictivo había ingresado a la casa, alrededor de las 09:00, después que uno de sus integrantes se había hecho pasar como empleado de una florería que iba a entregar un ramo de flores. El obsequio estaba dirigido a la dueña de la vivienda Aidé Vásquez Loor.
“Cuando abrí la puerta para firmar el recibido otro sujeto apareció y me apuntó con un arma”, relató Héctor Baque, empleado de Vásquez.
Tres hombres más, dos de ellos con pistolas, ingresaron también al inmueble y maniataron a Vásquez y sus cuatro hermanas.
Sin embargo, los ladrones no se percataron que en uno de los dormitorios estaba escondido José Chabuza Vargas, quien logró llamar a la Central de Atención de Auxilios y Emergencias de la Policía (CAAE).
En menos de cinco minutos elementos del Escuadrón Motorizado rodearon la casa e ingresaron. Dos de los antisociales fueron detenidos en el interior del inmueble, mientras que las capturas de los otros tres se produjeron en los techos y patios de las viviendas aledañas.
En el operativo un gendarme cayó del techo de la terraza de la edificación donde ocurrieron los hechos. Una ambulancia del Cuerpo de Bomberos lo trasladó al hospital de la institución policial. Presentaba rotura de cabeza y múltiples golpes en caderas y extremidades.
Treinta minutos después, los uniformados encontraron en el vecindario un revólver calibre 38 corto plateado y una pistola calibre 45, supuestamente usados por los atracadores para intimidar a sus víctimas.
Ante el fiscal Joffre González y el juez de Flagrancia, Víctor Moncada, los aprehendidos fueron identificados como Luis Alberto Hurtado Solís, Luis Alfredo Pilligua Vera, Julio César Aveiga Reyes, Freddy Gonzalo Mendoza Fernández y Franklin Javier Giménez Ramírez.
Los individuos ante las autoridades señaladas aseguraron que fueron contratados por Vásquez para cometer el atraco y apoderarse de una fuerte cantidad de dinero. Por aquello iban a recibir $ 30.000.
La versión de los apresados motivó que el fiscal se traslade al inmueble asaltado, donde encontró $ 60.000 y ordenó el traslado a la Policía Judicial del Guayas de Aidé Vásquez y su esposo Jorge Chabuza Vargas “hasta que justifiquen la procedencia del dinero”.Los sospechosos señalaron en la Fiscalía que ellos fueron contratados por la dueña de la vivienda para realizar el robo

description.hltext_display: 'Tatjana is verliefd'
description.content:
AMSTERDAM - Tatjana Simic moet kiezen tussen een RTL 4-programma waarin zij op zoek gaat naar een potentile partner of de partner die zij al heeft. Dat schrijft De Telegraaf.
Volgens geruchten is Tatjana meer dan goede vrienden met haar buurman Chris van Eeghen. Daarmee zou de zoektocht van de actrice in Wie kiest Tatjana? slechts schijn zijn.
De Telegraaf schrijft woensdag dat RTL er daarom aan denkt de show af te blazen. Tatjana ontkent de geruchten overigens.
Bronnen binnen de zender laten volgens de krant weten dat het tekenen van het contract al twee keer is uitgesteld.
Ook was de op 28 januari gepland staande eerste aflevering tijdelijk geschrapt, maar inmiddels toch weer aangekondigd bij de adverteerders.

description.hltext_display: Sortie de route mortelle pour une jeune Narbonnaise
description.content: Publié à 9 h 20 - Hier soir vers 18 h 30, une jeune Narbonnaise de 22 ans a trouvé la mort dans un accident à la sortie de Cruzy, en direction de La Croisade.Sans que lon sache pourquoi, sa Safrane a quitté la route avant de percuter un mur. Alertés les pompiers de Cruzy et les gendarmes de Saint-Chinian et Murviel ont longuement tenté de ranimer la jeune conductrice. Malheuresement en vain.

description.hltext_display: Remarks on the Vote on the General Assembly Resolution on Extrajudicial, Summary, and Arbitrary Executions contained in the Report of the Third Committee
description.content:
Thank you for this opportunity to take the floor after the vote.
The United States would like to thank countries for their support. We applaud those member states that have stood with us to oppose efforts seeking to block language on “sexual orientation” from this resolution.
Along with many countries in this room today, the United States was deeply disappointed by the vote in the third committee, which eliminated any mention of lesbian, gay, bisexual and transgender individuals from this resolution condemning extrajudicial killing of vulnerable people around the world.
The voices of civil society and human rights defenders around the world have indeed been heard by the member states of the United Nations – and for that my delegation is especially grateful. The General Assembly has sent a clear signal today that justice and human rights apply to all individuals regardless of their sexual orientation.
As Secretary General Ban Ki-moon said this year on Human Rights Day, the Universal Declaration of Human Rights applies to all human beings without exception and that “violence will end only when we confront prejudice.”
Having just celebrated the 62nd anniversary of the Universal Declaration of Human Rights, today’s vote ensures that the principles enshrined in that Declaration are put into practice and indeed live on in the 21st century. We have reaffirmed that “all human rights apply to all.” We hope that we can continue to make progress on this at the UN and that all member states will consider signing the statement on LGBT human rights before the UNGA.
We thank the member states of the General Assembly for their support today.
Thank you Mr. President.

article.source: US Embassy U.S. Mission to the U.N.-New York

description.hltext_display: Murder mystery "All Good Things" opens Wed. 12/22 a...
description.content:
All Good Things ** (R; 1:41): Usually when a movie is labeled as “based on true events,” there's an artistic license to make it more dramatic. In the case of “All Good Things,” changes were made to protect a suspected triple murderer who has served time for mutilating a body and is now walking free. By adding ambiguity to a well-known murder case, the movie sacrifices dramatic intensity and the compelling performances of its two leads.
Ryan Gosling plays David Marks, a thinly fictionalized version of Robert Durst, the son of a wealthy Manhattan developer. In the early '70s, aimless charmer David marries a middle-class beauty named Katie (Kirsten Dunst), at least partly to snub his father, Sanford Marks (Frank Langella), and to pursue a hippie-ish dream of running a health-food store.
But daddy wields a mighty wallet, and soon David is working as a rent collector for the family's Times Square porn emporiums. When Katie wants to have babies, David reveals a dark side of his personality, but his bullying has nothing to do with the family business, and we're not sure what it has to do with the occasional flash forwards to courtroom testimony about his privileged past.
When David refuses to pay for coked-out Katie to go to med school and she squeals to the feds about the family bookkeeping, this briefly becomes a crusader-on-the-run film—but then Katie disappears from the story under circumstances that are more muddy than menacing.
Then suddenly it's decades later and David is living in Texas as a mute transvestite, with a cranky Vietnam veteran (Philip Baker Hall) to do the dirty work against a ghost from David's past. With so much tantalizing weirdness to cram into the last act of an otherwise shapeless saga, director Andrew Jarecki essentially throws up his hands.
Jarecki made the powerful documentary “Capturing the Friedmans,” another film that couldn't decide if its characters were guilty or innocent, but here the irresolution feels like a cop out.
There's a fascinating story here for a bolder filmmaker, but after so much meandering it's a relief that “All Good Things” must come to an end.
(At Plaza Frontenac.)

description.hltext_display: 'Oprah wil Bono als presentator'
description.content:
AMSTERDAM - Oprah Winfrey heeft Bono aangeboden een eigen programma te presenteren voor haar nieuwe zender. De zanger heeft naar verluidt bedankt. Winfrey is druk bezig met het scouten van presentatietalent voor haar nieuwe project. Winfrey stopt in september na 25 jaar definitief met de presentatie van The Oprah Winfrey Show. Haar zender Oprah Winfrey Network gaat uitzenden vanaf 1 januari.
"Ik bekijk alles met een blik van wat goede televisie zou kunnen opleveren", zegt de presentatrice in een interview met de New York Times.
Winfrey peilde U2-zanger Bono tijdens een diner. Sarah Ferguson heeft al getekend voor een eigen programma.
"Ik had opeens een openbaring. Jij als spiritueel, kwetsbaar persoon", zei Winfrey toen ze de ex-vrouw van de Britse prins Andrew vroeg. "Dat is geniaal", reageerde Ferguson.

description.hltext_display: La lluvia generó enredo vial ayer
description.content:
Técnicos de la concesionaria Interagua inspeccionaron, el fin de semana, tanto la bomba de succión instalada en la Planta de Las Orquídeas, así como el canal de drenaje que rodea al programa habitacional de Mucho Lote, en el norte de Guayaquil.
Este recorrido se dio ante el inicio de las primeras lluvias que ayer provocaron el colapso del alcantarillado en algunas vías arterias de la ciudad.
El plan preinvernal comenzó con la limpieza de canales y sumideros, el pasado 25 de octubre. De acuerdo con lo previsto, este trabajo concluirá en 120 días.
Voceros de la empresa aseguraron que estas tareas tienen un avance general del 52 por ciento y que los lugares más propensos a inundaciones de vías son: Bastión Popular, Mapasingue y Las Orquídeas, en el norte.
Lo que se busca es mejorar la capacidad de conducción de las aguas lluvias, a través de las alcantarillas, sumideros y zanjas para de esta forma mitigar las inundaciones generadas durante las precipitaciones.
Con el fin de evitar situaciones como las de ayer, que colapsaron el tráfico vehicular en algunas de las más importantes arterias de la ciudad, la concesionaria aceleró su plan pre invernal.
Este contempla la limpieza de 164 canales, 59 ductos y 35 alcantarillas divididas en nueve macrolotes.
A esto se suma expurgar 42.205 sumideros, 13.150 cámaras y 30.930 metros de canaletas ubicados en las zonas norte, centro, oeste y sur de la capital del Guayas.Técnicos de la concesionaria Interagua inspeccionaron, el fin de semana, tanto la bomba de succión instalada en la Planta de Las Orquídeas.

description.hltext_display: Letters to the editor: Dec. 22, 2010
description.content:
It is Mr. Downey who is wrong in his Nov. 30 letter to the editor, "State should regulate drilling." Not only does the DEC not have the staff to enforce the GEIS and SGEIS now, but it has not for many years.
In the late 1990s, the permits section of the Bureau of Oil and Gas Regulation was approving about 100 permits with a staff of 20 and was making about 2,000 site inspections each year. As the Trenton/BlackRiver gas play developed, the annual permits gradually rose to 200 and site inspections to 3,400. By 2008 (last published annual report) staff had fallen to 19, permits had skyrocketed to 740, and site inspections had fallen to 2,500.
Today the staff is 17. The T/BR play is waning, but the Marcellus and Utica plays promise to be much larger and require much greater resources.
What is more, even in the quiet 1990s, the BOGR could not fulfill its responsibilities. As documented in the comptroller's audit 2005-S-54, unlike other producing states, New York did not make any attempt to verify the gas production as reported by energy companies. It did not require certified meters, test meters, take meter readings, or audit company books.
Last year, the follow-up audit 2009-F-1 found the only change was that companies now must test their own meters, but only on state leases. Anyone who hopes for royalties from gas production should be alarmed.
This is not to disparage the staff of BOGR. In my discussions with them, they have been knowledgeable and forthcoming. They are simply in over their head. (They are also reviewing 14,000 comments and revising the 800-page dSGEIS.) Full restoration of permit section staff is grossly inadequate. In the last two years, Pennsylvania Oil and Gas Management Bureau has hired more than 100 individuals, almost doubling the bureau.
Brian Brock
Franklin
County needs to address gas drilling
It is more than time for the Otsego County board to start fulfilling its responsibilities by addressing the important issue of possible large-scale gas fracking operations in the county. For months, the dangers of gas fracking have been made abundantly clear by reports from Pennsylvania and on a recent segment of "60 Minutes."
For nearly a year, the county's Natural Gas Advisory Committee has been meeting but has yet to make any recommendations. Well attended anti-fracking rallies have shown clearly that there is substantial opposition to drilling in the county. The recent cavalier behavior of the Gastem Company in refracking the Ross well on Crumhorn Mountain without notifying government or residents speaks volumes. Cleary, Gastem is prepared to walk all over local officials. Psalm Wikoff said that the state does not require drillers to inform local governments of drilling operations because terms such as "operation" and "local government" are open to interpretation, a nonsensical statement that suggests the lack of willingness to guard the public's interests. Given all of this, it's hard to escape the conclusion that county government is doing, not the public's business, but the gas companies'.
The recent anti-Democratic tsunami that hit the polls reflects voter frustration at government's abject failure to get the country out of its economic mess. The Democrats bore the brunt of it. But voters are aware of the complicity of the Republican Party, "the party of no" in that failure. So far, regarding gas fracking, this county government has been a government of "no responsibility, no oversight, no action" and yes, only to the frackers. It's time to wake up.
Cathy Mason
Springfield Center
We need to spend less
I'm exhausted from listening to politicians, pundits, talking heads, columnists and letter-writers who bemoan the wealthy not paying their fair share. Sam Pollak would have us believe we borrow money from China to subsidize the rich. Mr. Meyerson would have us believe that more tax on wealth created 22 million jobs. Can either of you spell non sequitur!? You and your ilk seem to think the government owns every dollar above some arbitrary threshold earned by those sufficiently intelligent, ambitious and motivated to create that wealth.
What I don't hear is how government on every level, bloated and inefficient, chooses to allocate our resources: from the feds spending unimaginable sums abroad to cure the world's ills, to local government supporting every impoverished unwed mother who chooses not to work. How about taking some personal responsibility? Oh no, it's about self-esteem, or it's not their fault, it's the fast-food industry, or soft drinks. In fact, let's create a tax just for them. On and on.
I was passing through the emergency room recently and ran into an acquaintance of the unemployed, unwed mother category. I asked why, under the circumstances, she didn't just make a doctor's appointment. This was more convenient, she said, and besides, she didn't have to pay for it. For a boil on her leg, oh please.
I'm all for farm subsidies for the local dairymen, not big Midwest agra turning corn into ethanol. What a waste.
I don't make a lot of money, but I live within my means, and not by spending my money like some jackass. I expect the same from government. There's more, but I only get 300 words to point out the glaringly obvious. I could just puke.
It's simple: Don't spend so much! What a concept.
Gary Caso
Delhi
Columnist should expand horizons
Three cheers for Tom Sears! His preposterous prattle is positively priceless!
Tom, it's time to expand your horizons. Spread your wings and fly! A mere column in a regional newspaper is an unworthy platform for a man who knows everything!
Have you heard that Quentin Tarantino will direct a remake of "The Ten Commandments"? He's seen your column, Tom, and he wants to cast you in the leading role as Moses-Gone-Meshugana! Here's a sample of the script. Start rehearsing now, Tom! Just act naturally.
Tom "Meshugana Moses" Sears: "Pharaoh, I demand that you let my people go from your tyrannical decree of health care for all! The God I serve will choose the time to lead His people to the other side of the donut hole! Just see what good your socialized, nanny-state health care plan does you, when we smite you with plagues like Rash Locustbaugh, Boils O'Licely, and the Bush that will burn your economy! Or when the waters of the Nile turn brown with tea!
"Which brings me to another of my favorite rants: What makes you think you're entitled to clean water? Why, you can't even secure your borders to keep out the Mexicans that sneak in from the bulrushes! For your information, the latest Pox News poll shows that 97 percent of all Egyptians oppose your big-government, secular-progressive Pyramid schemes, which will turn us all into vassals of the state!
"Whadiya mean, I'm a raving nincompoop who flunked freshman comp? What do I care? At least I sound Egyptian! (Stop that, Neferteri! Cut that out this instant!) Liberals shall be smitten! Tea time has begun!"

description.hltext_display: Man and boy killed in house blaze
description.content:
A man and a young boy have died after a house fire caused by a chip pan left unattended on a cooker, emergency services said.
West Midlands Ambulance Service said both victims were confirmed dead shortly after their arrival at hospital following the blaze in the Lower Stoke area of Coventry.
An ambulance service spokesman said three ambulances and a paramedic officer were sent to the property in Hollis Road after several 999 calls.

description.hltext_display: Concluding Remarks at a Special Security Council Event for Voices of a New Generation
description.content:
Okay, I’m going to try to address the question about cyber-terrorism in the context of some concluding remarks, speaking on behalf of myself and the United States.
And I wanted to begin just with what I’ve learned from listening to the videos that you saw [note: click to view videos by Fabiola Estrada (Venezuela), Gloria Ramazani (DRC), and Oussama Bessassi (Tunisia)], from the ones that you will see at the conclusion of our program in a few minutes, and from what I’ve heard from you all, as you have been kind enough to share your thoughts and questions with us.
On the Security Council, we have a pretty defined and traditional agenda. Our agenda is to focus on those things that immediately and directly affect international peace and security. And so much of the work that the Council does and most of the missions that we send out to different parts of the world, are either about preventing conflict, responding to conflict and therefore protecting people in the midst of conflict, or trying to build up societies and countries after conflict: what we call peace-building. And so the prevention work we do is diplomacy; it’s sometimes behind closed doors; sometimes the Secretary General might send a Special Envoy; sometimes the Council as a whole goes out on a mission to try to support the preservation of peace – as we did a few months ago, when the whole Security Council went to Sudan. And Sudan is a big issue on our agenda. We’re particularly focused now on the upcoming referendum, in which the people of Southern Sudan will make a decision about whether they want to stay part of Sudan or become independent. And this is an issue that has the potential to end very peacefully and smoothly or end in a violent way. And so the Security Council has been focusing a lot of its effort and energy on the kind of preventive diplomacy that we hope will help diminish the risk of conflict.
We’ve done that in places like Guinea and West Africa, where they have just come through a very difficult set of elections. We’re doing it now on the ground in Haiti, where the UN peacekeeping mission is trying to not only help rebuild after the earthquake and help deal with the cholera epidemic, but also help to resolve the dispute that has arisen over the recent elections.
But the UN also responds to conflict and puts people on the ground to try to protect those who are in harm’s way. And that’s what the UN is doing in Darfur, and in Congo, in Eastern Congo, where we heard from Gloria. There are some 20,000 UN peacekeepers on the ground and in many other parts of the world. And then we also try to help societies rebuild after they emerge from conflict. And we have UN forces on the ground doing that in Liberia. We have smaller peace-building missions in places like Sierra Leone, and support operations in places like East Timor. That’s sort of the bread and butter of what the United Nations Security Council does in the realm of peace and security.
We also work to fight terrorism and to prevent the proliferation of weapons of mass destruction, prevent nuclear powers emerging outside of the framework of the non-proliferation treaty and to impose sanctions and other measures, as necessary, to prevent the spread of nuclear weapons.
That’s the day to day work we do. It’s very important, and we’re all deeply committed to it. But what we’ve heard from you young people today, in your letters, in your videos, in your questions, is that you also want us to be very much focused on those conditions, those circumstances, those events that can give rise to conflict. We’ve heard about the importance of tackling poverty.
And let me just share with you for those who don’t know. Poverty is a major driver of conflict. We’ve heard many people say that. Let me share with you just one statistic. In countries where the average person earns only 250 dollars a year – those are some of the poorest countries in the world – the scientifically proven risk of conflict, civil conflict, within a five-year time frame, is 15 percent – excuse me – is 15 percent. So where you have an average per capita income of 250 dollars a year, there’s a 15 percent risk of civil conflict within a five-year period. Where you have 5,000 dollars a year annual average per capita income – that’s a middle income country – the risk of civil conflict over the same five-year period is less than one percent.
There are huge gains for peace and stability to be won with development. And the young people understand that. I think members of the Security Council and the United Nations, I think you heard the Secretary-General say we are increasingly understanding that.
But you are asking us to look at those things, not just poverty but conflict over resources, water, competition for energy, climate change, intolerance, lack of education, radicalization, all of these as factors, that can fuel conflict or undermine peace and security. And to be very candid, there are many parts of the United Nations system that do those things every day. We have UNICEF on the ground providing health and education and shelter to kids who need it. We have the UN Development Program helping to foster sustainable development and good governance and democracy. We have the World Food Program delivering relief supplies all over the world every day. But in the Security Council we still take a pretty traditional view of what the promotion and protection of peace and security means.
And coming to the question of cyber security or cyber terrorism – to be quite candid, that is not an issue that is presently on the agenda of the Security Council. I think if we were candid and we discussed it, there would be some controversy or disagreement on whether it should be. It’s not become, in our estimation, a traditional issue of peace and security. But I am old enough to remember in 1999, under another U.S. Presidency of the Security Council, led by the late Ambassador Richard Holbrooke – where the Security Council put on its agenda for the first time disease, and specifically HIV/AIDS, as a threat to international peace and security. In the year 2010 it doesn’t take a great deal of imagination to understand that HIV/AIDS and other pandemics are a threat to international peace and security. And so, it may be before too long that issues like cyber security and cyber terrorism are equally well understood to be of the sort that perhaps merits the attention of the Security Council.
So I want to thank you for raising it and I want to thank all of you in closing for the really extraordinarily thoughtful, insightful, perspectives that you shared with us here in this room, via video, via email, via written note, I hope this is not the last time that the Security Council has the opportunity not just to hear from young people, but to work on behalf of young people, very consciously and very directly.
I think of this event as just the very beginning, a youth event with the Security Council version 1.0. We need to find more frequent and more meaningful ways to bring your perspectives, your voices, your insights to bear on the work we do. I have a dream that one day I will wake up and look at the table in the Security Council chamber where sadly we were not able to be today, and see it on occasion populated by people your age, talking about, debating, thinking through the most important issues of the day. And we would all learn and benefit from that. So, maybe we’ll get there one day; this is a first step.
And I want to thank you all for participation, your patience, your flexibility. I want to very much thank my colleagues on the Security Council. And I want to thank the Secretary-General and all of the staff of the Secretariat who worked so hard to put this together after the upset we had of our original plan. So thank you all, and now I want to conclude by showing this video montage. It’s about eight minutes, of some of the videos that we were not able to discuss but wanted you to see.
Thank you very much.
Note: Ambassador Rice’s remarks were followed by a concluding video montage, which you may access here. The montage’s featured participants are listed here.

article.source: US Embassy U.S. Mission to the U.N.-New York

description.hltext_display: UGI energy company opens new offices
description.author: Andrew Maykuth
description.content:
A year after a fire forced UGI Corp. to evacuate all 350 employees from its King of Prussia corporate headquarters, the energy company on Tuesday cut the ribbon on its newly renovated offices.
A Dec. 16, 2009, electrical fire spread soot throughout the five-story, 100,000-square-foot building on North Gulph Road, forcing the company to relocate its employees to leased space in Audubon, said Marcia Vogt, UGI's facilities manager. "It's quite an endeavor to move 350 people, including all the incidentals," Vogt said. UGI used the opportunity to renovate the 38-year-old building, replacing heating, air-conditioning, lighting, and computer systems. "The fire turned out to be a blessing in disguise," Vogt said. "The building was quite dated." The smoke damage was so extensive that virtually every piece of paper in the offices needed to be deodorized in special ozone chambers constructed during the renovation. "We got rid of all the furniture - the smoke smell was so embedded in everything," she said. The work was coordinated by Belfor USA, a disaster-recovery company with local offices in Exton.
Vogt said UGI was still negotiating with its insurance carrier to determine how much of the renovation costs will be covered.
According to UGI's annual report, it has budgeted about $12.7 million for headquarters renovations.
Contact staff writer Andrew Maykuth at 215-854-2947 or amaykuth@phillynews.com.

description.hltext_display: St. Louis critics pick "Social Network"...
description.content:
The St. Louis Film Critics group has selected "The Social Network" as the best film of 2010 and its director, David Fincher as best director. Other winners are Colin Firth of "The King's Speech" as best actor, Natalie Portman of "Black Swan" as best actress, and Christian Bale and Melissa Leo of "The Fighter" as best supporting actor and actress, respectively.
The group comprises more than 40 movie critics for newspapers, magazines, broadcast outlets and websites in the St. Louis metro area.
The results of the voting were announced Sunday during a star-studded gala at the legendary C.J. Muggs restaurant in Webster Groves.
Here are the other winners:
Best Cinematography: True Grit (Roger Deakins)
Best Music: Social Network (Trent Reznor)
Best Visual Effects: Inception
Best Original Screenplay: The King’s Speech (David Seidler)
Best Adapted Screenplay: The Social Network (Aaron Sorkin)
Best Foreign-Language Film: Micmacs
Best Documentary: The Tillman Story
Best Comedy: Scott Pilgrim vs the World
Best Animated Film: Toy Story 3
Best Independent/Art-House Film: Micmacs
Moving the Medium Forward (for technical/artistic innovative that advances the medium): Inception
Best Scene (tie): 127 Hours, for the stranded-miles-from-help-shot; and Inception, for the spinning-hallway battle

description.hltext_display: Diodes Inc. Releases Programmable Battery Charger to Keep Portable Products Safe
description.content:
Power Channels: Batteries and Portable Power, Power Quality Protection
The APM860x lithium battery charger ICs from Diodes Inc. provide a range of safety features designed to protect small form factor portable products during the charging process. To ensure safe charging of products including mobile phones, media players and headsets, the single channel APM8600 and dual channel APM8601 constantly monitor lithium ion and lithium polymer cells for overvoltage, charge time and temperature. Providing up to 28V overvoltage protection, the APM8601 automatically selects between USB or dc inputs, and the APM8600 is a dc input only device.
The ICs’ charging algorithm covers all lithium cell charging phases, comprising pre-charging for deeply depleted cells, constant current/constant voltage fast charging and top-off charging to hold the cell at its full charge level. Maximum fast charging current is 1A, with charge current from the USB input set to either 100 or 500mA depending on the logic level applied to USEL input.
Fully programmable via external component selection, the APM86’s charging current, pre-charging and end-of-charge are determined by resistor value and the charge time by capacitor value. Cell temperature measurement is achieved via a standard thermistor located in close proximity to the cell. Charge indicator pins are provided for charging status display.
Provided in the U-DFN3030 14-pin package, the dual input APM8601 charger is priced at $ 0.53 each in 10k quantities and the single input APM8600 charger is priced at $ 0.48 each in 10 k quantities.

description.hltext_display: Puolueet pääsemässä sopuun perustuslakiuudistuksen kiistoista
description.content:
Hallituspuolueet ja Sdp ovat löytämässä sovun perustuslakiuudistuksen kiistakohdista. Pääministeri Mari Kiviniemi (kesk) vahvisti asian aamun neuvottelun jälkeen, mutta ei suostunut kertomaan sovun yksityiskohdista.
Oppositiopuolue Sdp on vaatinut muutamia muutoksia hallituksen esitykseen, joka vähentää edelleen presidentin valtaa. Puheenjohtaja Jutta Urpilainen oli hyvin tyytyväinen neuvottelun jälkeen.
Yksi kiista on koskenut sitä, miten päätös tehdään eduskunnassa, jos se joutuu ratkaisijan asemaan hallituksen ja presidentin ristiriidoissa. Sdp on vaatinut, että eduskunnassa asian ratkaisee täysistunto.

description.hltext_display: Dalai Lama Is Right
description.content: THE Dalai Lama, according to the latest release of WikiLeaks cables, told US diplomats that, for Tibet, climate change is a more urgent issue than a political settlement. This will certainly dismay some of the more radical elements of the region´s independence movement. Many of the younger Tibetans in exile are already frustrated with their spiritual leader´s moderate and non-violent approach. For them, independence will always trump the environment. But if the concern is the survival of the nomadic peoples of the Tibetan plateau, the Dalai Lama is right. Exile activists...
